When he turns back, he finds W.D. glaring at him. INT. THE “BARNUM ARMS” —- DAY 72 A pub across from the museum. Barnum sits at the bar with Tom Thumb, Lettie, and O’Clancy, a stack of newspapers in front of them. He reads from Roth’s review in the Tribune

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: “,.. Barnum’s reputation as the national clearinghouse for the grotesque remains firmly intact. How much longer will the public indulge this man’s reckless forays into the unseemly depths of bad taste?” (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 53.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (incredulous) Can you believe he’s reviewing us again?!

dialogues.speaker: LETTIE
dialogues.text: What do you care about Roth for? He’s a prig and a snob.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Yes, and all the snobs in New York read him. He does their thinking for them. Barnum throws the paper down, frustrated. Phillip bursts into the pub. Clearly excited.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you seen this?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I have.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I thought I was paying you to class up the joint.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I've been working on it. Everyone...? He turns to the others, holds up a folded piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you want society to accept you, do you start at the bottom? Or in the middle? No -- you start at the very top.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: And what’s the top? He hands the paper to Barnum. It’s a telegram. He reads:

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: “You are hereby invited to an audience with Her Royal Majesty, Victoria...” (looks up, stunned) Is this real?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: It took some doing, but I got us invited to England! To meet with the Queen! GASPS and CHEERS from the assembled Performers.

dialogues.speaker: LETTIE
dialogues.text: The Queen, huh? How much is she payin’? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 54. (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum stares at the telegram, a smile forming. EXT. BARNUM MANSION —- FRONT PORCH - A FEW NIGHTS LATER Charity sits on the porch swing as Barnum alights from a carriage and rushes up the front walk to join her.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Sorry I’m late. Are the kids in bed?

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: They tried to stay awake for you... Barnum sits next to her on the swing, upset to miss them.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: There’s just a hundred things to do -- sending the whole troupe to London...

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: I know, Phin. It’s okay. She rubs his back, and gazes at him, already sad.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know what I realized? We haven’t spent a night apart since we got married.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I have to go. If the Queen of England likes us, everyone there will.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: And everyone here too. Barnum smiles, she can always see through him. She leans He kisses

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I don’t mind if people call me coarse. But when my daughters suffer for it... (shakes his head; quietly) ...It breaks my heart.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Just tell me I’m not going to lose you the snobs. in, playful. Barnum pulls her into an

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Not to them. Not to anyone. her passionately. MUSIC starts under. to embrace. 72 73  The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum sings a farewell LULLABY (that will become a duet Charity), to Helen and Caroline, both of whom are asleep.

dialogues.speaker: WITHOUT A WORRY IN THE WORLD
dialogues.text: Next he sings to Charity, as she sleeps:

dialogues.speaker: WILL BE THERE
dialogues.text: LOOK AROUND I’M RIGHT BESIDE YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Music continues to play under as Charity watches from ato the stairs as Barnum prepares to leave. From downstairs, Barnum catches her eye, and smiles lovingly at her. She smiles back and comes downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: WITHOUT A WORRY IN THE WORLD.
dialogues.text: Barnum kisses her and steps out the front door. SONG ENDS as we linger on Charity at the front door, watc him go -- a look of concern on her face. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The circus performers disembark from their carriages. The have all tried to dress up, with varying success. Anne we a dazzling gown. Phillip helps her down from her carriage (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Miss Wheeler. You look like royalty.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I’m just an acrobat.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: No. In the aristocracy of talent, I would say you are a Queen. His meaning is clear. She meets his eyes, then moves on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group is led down an endless hall by a prim and LORD-IN-WAITING. Even dressed up, they look wildly place. The enormous Lord of Leeds is wheezing and falling behind. Tom Thumb tugs on the bottom of his coat.

dialogues.speaker: TOM THUMB
dialogues.text: Only a mile to go, tubs. Don’t die on me.

dialogues.speaker: LORD OF LEEDS
dialogues.text: I won’t die on you. I may sit on you...

dialogues.speaker: LORD-IN-WAITING
dialogues.text: Don’t speak to the Queen unless spoken to. Don’t offer your hand unless she offers hers first. And never turn your back on Her Royal Highness. You must enter and exit the room facing forward.

dialogues.speaker: LETTIE
dialogues.text: Well, at least she can’t talk about us behind our backs! LAUGHS and HOOTS. Phillip shoots Barnum a glance,

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I’m starting to think this was a bad idea.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: This was your idea!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have listened to me! I’m an apprentice, for God's sake! 78 INT. BUCKINGHAM PALACE - QUEEN’S DRAWING ROOM - DAY The double doors open to the Queen’s drawing room. of the royal entourage, luminaries, and visitors ar 76 77 proper out of sotto: 78 Members e present. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 78 79 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 57.

dialogues.speaker: HERALD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen, Mr. Phineas T. Barnum and his troupe from America -- Barnum enters with Tom, Lettie, Chang and Eng, and the Lo of Leeds, all five hundred pounds. Anne follows in her go with Phillip on one side, W.D. on the other. The place fa silent. Everyone stares as a path is cleared to... QUEEN VICTORIA, 30. Barnum and Tom, leading the way, slow approach the seated queen. Beside her is a small KING CHA SPANIEL on a leash held by one of her courtiers.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Your Majesty. It is in an honor to meet you. May I present Mr. Phineas T. Barnum.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I am honored, Your Highness.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN VICTORIA
dialogues.text: The honor is mine, Mr. Barnum. And I have heard all about your little Colonel from my friends in America.

dialogues.speaker: TOM THUMB
dialogues.text: General, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: QUEEN VICTORIA
dialogues.text: Forgive me. General. Oh My! You’re even smaller than I expected.

dialogues.speaker: TOM THUMB
dialogues.text: You're not exactly reaching the top shelf yourself, sweetheart. The assembled nobility GASP. Phillip holds his breath. Th room remains silent until the Queen suddenly bursts into laughter. Everyone immediately joins in, relieved. The Queen’s dog starts to BARK at Tom -- who barks right back. They growl and nip and tug at each other. The Queen throws her head back, laughing even harder at Tom’s antic Barnum and Phillip share a look of relief.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: INT. BUCKINGHAM PALACE - QUEEN’S DRAWING ROOM - LATER 79 Barnum’s group is now off to the side, mingling with othe guests. Lettie stands proud and pretty. Chang and Eng bow each side. Tom grabs a creamy pastry off a passing server tray and bites into it, leaving a dab of cream on his nos (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 58.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: There is a small stir near the doors, as the crowd is hus

dialogues.speaker: HERALD
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, Miss Jenny Lind. GUESTS applaud as JENNY LIND enters. In her early 30's, s is a stunning Scandinavian beauty. Barnum turns to Philli

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Only the most famous singer in Europe.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Another singer, huh? He rolls his eyes. But as he watches everyone scurry to f a crowd around Miss Lind, Barnum’s expression changes. As he watches, the Queen herself (regal but plain) chats smiles with Jenny, clearly taken by her beauty and presen On Barnum, watching as the old-fashioned royalty of birth superceded by the new royalty of talent, beauty, celebrit Suddenly, it clicks for him. He takes off across the room headed for Miss Lind. Phillip, alarmed, rushes to keep up

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: To meet Miss Lind.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: You can’t just march up to someone like that and talk to them --

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Why not? I’m personable, and she’s a person. He quickens his pace. Phillip scrambles to keep up. As Je withdraws from the royal presence and Barnum steps up to

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Miss Lind. My name is P.T. Barnum.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: From America. I’ve heard of you. She smiles slyly -- suggesting what she’s heard. He grins (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 59.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Well, if you heard of me all the way over here, I must be doing something right.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (suggestive) Or else very wrong.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: When it comes to publicity, Miss Lind, there’s hardly a difference.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (mock admonishment ) Between right and wrong? Those are words of a scoundrel, Mr. Barnum.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: A showman, Miss Lind. Just a showman. He gives her his most winning smile. She returns it. They are on the same wavelength, speaking the same language.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: And what can I do for you, Mr. Barnum?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I'd like to bring you to America. That surprises her. She smiles at him.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Is that a proposition?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Mrs. Barnum would be displeased. But I’d like to put you on tour there.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Have you heard me sing?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: No. And I look forward to it very much. But I see the way everyone in this room is looking at you. You outshine the Queen herself. That’s all I need to know.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (intrigued) I've never been to America. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 80 81 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 60.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: It will be the largest musical event ever staged. The grandest theaters! The finest orchestras! The best of everything! And when you’re done you’1ll have more money than you can spend in a dozen lifetimes.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I give most of my earnings to charity, Mr. Barnum -- to widows and orphans.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Then all the more reason to say yes! Jenny laughs, charmed by his unflappable optimism. Her ey take him in. Intrigued, possibly even attracted.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I have to ask, Mr. Barnum, why me? Barnum thinks about it -- a moment of real reflection.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: People come to my shows for the pleasure of being hoodwinked. Just once I'd like to give them something that can’t be faked. Something real. Jenny smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Well... Honesty. I didn’t expect that. Barnum smiles back. He has her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stone castle in Battery Park. A CROWD surges past POSTE touting the ‘PREMIERE CONCERT OF THE SWEDISH NIGHTINGALE!

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, I recently had the pleasure of hearing the most incredible--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spectacular circular theatre. Barnum stands on stage. H nods to Charity, Caroline and Helen, dressed to the nines

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: ..-Most divine voice I have ever heard. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 81 82 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 61.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A WOMAN sitting behind Charity turns to her HUSBAND, scof

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN IN AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Suddenly he’s a connoisseur? Caroline looks down, embarrassed. Charity takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Now I know that sounds like Barnum hype. This gets a warm laugh. Barnum spots Roth in the audience arms folded, prepared to disapprove --

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But I have no doubt that tonight, even the most joyless critics will be moved. He catches Roth’s eyes and grins.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: May I present the Swedish Nightingale, Miss Jenny Lind. A ten-piece orchestra starts to play. Jenny appears far upstage and walks quietly forward, a mirage coming into f in a simple but stunning dress. There’s an audible reacti to her beauty. Charity’s grip on Caroline’s hand tightens Then Jenny sings. SONG: An epic love song. Jenny’s voice, and the song itse both stun with their beauty and power. In the audience, Phillip gazes at Anne. She looks over. T eyes meet, finding meaning in the words. Then she looks a Barnum, backstage, watches, surprised to find himself mov by the simplicity and beauty of her song. He turns and peeks out at the audience. An entire theater filled with high society, embracing Jenny and, in a way, He gazes on Caroline, her face impossible to read.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC continues under. There’s an air of excitement that only comes after a perfect show. Cheers continue as Jenny leaves the stage, followed by STAGEHANDS carrying BOUQUET She is met by Barnum, who looks at her, truly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Miss Lind...! It was, well... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 62.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: (laughs ) Why Mr. Barnum, I believe you are speechless. Charity rushes in with the girls.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Miss Lind, I’ve never heard anything so divine.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Aren’t you lovely.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I'd like you to meet my wife, Charity. And our girls, Caroline and Helen.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: A pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: You look like a princess, ma’am.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: But you’re the beautiful one. She offers Helen her hand -- to shake, or to kiss, Helen isn’t sure. So she curtsies. Caroline steps forward, shyl

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: You have the most exquisite voice!

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Thank you, dear. Do you perform?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Yes, I... I’m studying Ballet.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: You are?!

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Of course I am. Barnum turns to Charity and beams.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Of course she is.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: My class will perform at the Met Gala this year. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 82 83 84 85 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 63.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Oh! What I would give to see that! (takes Caroline’s hand) I think you and I are going to be very good friends. Caroline glows. Barnum puts his arm around Charity -- he pulled off the impossible. INT. THE “BARNUM ARMS” - DAY 83 Barnum sits at a table as Phillip runs in with the paper.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Hot off the press. Barnum flips through roughly, looking for the review. As reads it, his expression goes from elation to dismay.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: “Jenny Lind’s singing is both ethereal and transcendent. In the hands of a true purveyor of the arts, this would be a cause for celebration. But now we can only watch in dismay as the notorious P.T. Barnum inevitably turns her into one of his sideshow freaks. Next thing we know, she'll be sporting a beard.” (stops reading) What is wrong with that man?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Like most critics, Roth just vents the bitterness over his own failures by attacking those who succeed. Just take comfort in the fact that every time you sell a ticket, a little part of him dies.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Well, then. Let’s sell more tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUND OF: Ecstatic applause. Calls of “Brava” and “Encore Night after night, the ‘SOLD OUT’ sign is hung in the box office window. INT. CASTLE GARDEN THEATER - JENNY’S DRESSING ROOM - NIGH The room is crammed with well-heeled ADMIRERS and bouquet flowers. Barnum glad-hands people while Charity feigns interest. Jenny smiles politely, accepting accolades. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 64.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WINTHROP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Barnum. He turns to see the Winthrops, in the doorway, slightly a sea. Mrs. Winthrop turns to her husband, who takes his cu

dialogues.speaker: MR. WINTHROP
dialogues.text: Barnum. I confess, I had my doubts... But this is a triumph. Well done, sir. Barnum lights up, claps Winthrop on the back. It’s taken lifetime to get here.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Thank you very much, Mr. Winthrop. Charity watches from across the room, somewhat concerned.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WINTHROP
dialogues.text: Do you suppose we might... That is...

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: You want to meet Miss Lind?

dialogues.speaker: MRS. WINTHROP
dialogues.text: If it’s not asking too much.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Not at all! Not at all! Barnum pulls them in the room, closes the door, but there an immediate KNOCK. Barnum opens the door again, expectin more Swells. This time, however, it is Lettie, Tom Thumb, O’Clancy, and all the rest of the oddities. They smile.

dialogues.speaker: LETTIE
dialogues.text: Mr. B... You think we could meet Miss Lind? Good Lord, that lady can sing! Barnum wavers, looks back in the room -- at the Winthrops Jenny, etc. He turns back. And makes the wrong choice...

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: It’s a bit crowded right now, Lettie. Why don’t you all come back later? The Oddities are surprised and insulted. Before they can respond, Barnum has closed the door on them. Charity sees this, and frowns, as Barnum leads the Winthrops to Jenny.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: 86 87 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 65. INT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - NIGHT 86 Tom Thumb sits, playing the Ukulele to the sold out crowd Lettie sings “Oddities”, a celebration of the self-accept that Barnum has given them, but somehow can’t give himsel

dialogues.speaker: INTO SUCH AN ODDITY
dialogues.text: Is IT SO WRONG

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S GOT TO BE A PURPOSE FOR ME.
dialogues.text: The other Oddities appear on stage to harmonize.

dialogues.speaker: CHANG AND ENG
dialogues.text: (Harmonizing)

dialogues.speaker: YOU'LL FIND IN ME
dialogues.text: THAT WE’RE ALL *

dialogues.speaker: ODDITIES
dialogues.text: ON BARNUM in the wings, watching the show with one eye, a his pocket watch with the other. Finally, he grabs his co

dialogues.speaker: ODDITIES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: WE’RE THE MONSTERS * WE’RE THE FREAKS WE’RE THE MISFITS WE’RE THE FREAKS EXT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - SAME 87 Barnum exits. On the sidewalk is a small CROWD of PROTEST holding signs: “Close the Circus!” and “No More Freak Sho

dialogues.speaker: ODDITIES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: IT AIN’T SO WRONG *

dialogues.speaker: TO ONE FAMILY...
dialogues.text: Barnum slows for a second -- he’s never seen these people Then he climbs into a waiting carriage. It drives off. *  88 89 90 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum finds Jenny signing autographs and greeting high- society type in a backstage hallway. He attempts to mingl but no one has any interest in him. He greets a Couple wh don’t respond in kind. He himself is an oddity there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anne, in her Sunday finest, window shops outside a clothi store. She goes to enter, only to have the door shut in h face. A sign is flipped from “Open” to “Closed for Lunch” She absorbs this indignity, stoic, and moves on. Across t street, Phillip has seen this. His heart breaks for her.

dialogues.speaker: ODDITIES, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: IT AIN’T SO WRONG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum smiles and nods to a well-heeled couple, who completely ignore him as they walk past. We INTERCUT:

dialogues.speaker: THE ODDITIES 89
dialogues.text: Singing raucously, then, back to...

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, IN THE HALLWAY 90
dialogues.text: Trying to engage. People squeeze past, jostling as they t to get to Jenny Lind. Finally, he gives up. He turns and watches as the cream of New York society crowds around Je showering her with the respect they will never give to hi TRACK IN on Barnum, alone, as he stares at Jenny. She is personification of everything he’s ever wanted for himsel Then, in the midst of the crowd, she glances up and sees watching her. She smiles at him with warmth and gratitude he’s made all this come true. A connection across the roo Something stirs in Barnum -- a consuming, almost patholog need for acceptance and adulation. He sees now he will ne get there on his own. He needs Jenny Lind. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e % a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 90 91 92 93 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 67.

dialogues.speaker: ODDITIES, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: WE’RE THE MONSTERS WE’RE THE FREAKS WE’RE THE MISFITS WE’RE THE FREAKS INT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - SAME 91 BACK AND FORTH between Barnum and the Oddities, wrapping

dialogues.speaker: TO ONE FAMILY
dialogues.text: AND WE’RE ALL

dialogues.speaker: ODDITIES.... ODDITIES
dialogues.text: The number ends and the crowd APPLAUDS wildly, on their f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum stares as Jenny chats with the Winthrops. Grimly * determined, he moves forward to join the conversation. He puts on a smile as he joins them, bowing to Mrs. Winth and shaking Mr. Winthrop’s hand. It’s like shaking hands with the Devil. As circus APPLAUSE echoes, we CUT TO: *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. People mingle in the drawing room, while Jenny sta beside the piano, greeting well-wishers. Barnum and Chari stand to one side, taking it all in. Charity asks quietly

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Remind me why you agreed to a private recital for the Winthrops?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: They asked.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Simple as that? She smiles, wry. Barnum shrugs. She knows him too well. Charity looks across the room, and gasps softly.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my God... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 93 94 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 68.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Barnum follows her gaze to the older couple that has just entered, looking somewhat uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: My parents. Charity makes eye contact with Mr. and Mrs. Hallet from across the room. Her mother offers an uncertain smile. PRE-LAP: Jenny’s singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny sings to the assembled guests, accompanied by a lon pianist. Caroline sits between Barnum and Charity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jenny sings, her eyes find Barnum’s in the audience an rest there, like she’s singing to him. Charity clocks the look between them warily. Barnum turns, surveys the audie listening raptly. He finally has an act they can’t say no The SONG ends in applause. Caroline, looking around at th reactions of her friends and parents, smiles and claps. As Jenny bows, Barnum joins her in the center of the room He takes her hands and kisses her ceremonially on each ch

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Thank you all very much. And thank you, Miss Lind, for sharing your gift with us. You know, ladies and gentlemen, these days, I am largely associated with elephants and acrobats and oddities. Here he smiles and gets a bit of a chuckle from the crowd

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But to me, the noblest art is that of making others happy. And that applies to a circus for the masses, or a virtuoso vocalist for you good people here. Barnum pauses. ON Charity and Caroline, watching nervousl

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: (to herself) No, don’t... Don’t, don’t, please don’t! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 94 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 69.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I grew up not far from here. As a matter of fact, my father tended the lawns of some of your homes. So I never imagined I'd actually be an honored guest in one of them. Or that I’d own the largest house in the neighborhood. Charity closes her eyes in dismay.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Actually, I did imagine it. When you’re born into poverty -- and treated with scorn because of it -- (glares at the Hallets) -- imagination is your only recourse. Mr. Hallet returns the glare angrily, feeling the eyes of room suddenly on him. Abruptly, he stands and, taking his Wife by the arm, exits the room -- walking out in a huff. This is an act of social aggression, intended to ostraciz Barnum. It works: the Winthrops look embarrassed. There a MURMURS of disapproval. Judgmental eyes turn back to Barn Barnum, caught off guard, looks up sees the pained expressions of Charity and Caroline. Awkwardly, he wraps

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And right now I imagine I’ve said a bit too much. Thank you for letting us entertain you. Good night. Polite applause. Barnum looks to Caroline, who is mortifi As he walks back to rejoin them, Caroline turns, walks aw Barnum is stung. Charity looks at him -- sad, acerbic.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: You still know how to charm my parents, don’t you?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I don’t worry anymore about impressing your parents.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Clearly. She follows Caroline off. Barnum is left alone. He gazes around the room -- suddenly, a social pariah again. His f hardens -- the chip on his shoulder has just become huge.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is insanity...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH  95 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 70. INT. BARNUM’'S MUSEUM - BARNUM’S OFFICE - DAY 95 CLOSE ON a poster for the Jenny Lind tour. It is wildly extravagant -- the 19th Century version of Las Vegas. Bar loves it. Phillip is desperately trying to reason with hi

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: ..-A ninety piece orchestra?! Custom sets! Indoor fireworks! No one’s ever done anything like this!

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Exactly! We're giving the world something they’ve never seen before!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: With good reason! You've had to pay the theaters in advance! You’ve paid Jenny in advance! You won’t see a penny of profit til the fortieth show, at least! You're risking everything you've built!

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: And how do you think I built it? By risking everything! Phillip flops down in a chair, anxious and overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Calm down, man. What’s eating you? Phillip holds up a telegram.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Miss Lind’s contract.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Isn't it done?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: She won't sign. You’re asking her to do two shows a night. She insists on one. You've got to hold the line on this, P.T. You're risking too much already.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I’1l handle Miss Lind. Barnum plucks the contract from Phillip’s fingers, grabs hat, heads for the exit. Phillip turns.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Or will she handle you? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 96 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 71.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Barnum is already gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum walks in to find Jenny finishing a lunch. He has t papers in his hand, looking serious. She sees him, smiles

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Mr. Barnum! To what do I owe the pleasure?!

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I received a draft of your contract.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Oh, dear. Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Not at all. It’s just that I have booked each hall for two shows a night...

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: ...-And I can only perform once. Barnum is baffled by this. He strains to be polite.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Is there something else you will be doing for twenty three hours?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Mr. Barnum, I am not a cuckoo clock. To be perfect, my voice requires rest.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: If it is just less than perfect, I assure you, no one will know the difference.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I will know the difference.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: But you are not buying tickets.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You told me you wanted the best for this tour, Mr. Barnum. Or was that humbug too? Her challenge throws Barnum. He struggles to control hims

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I am paying you top dollar. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 72.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: This isn’t about money...

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: What else could it be about? She looks at him with affection. She’s tacitly pleading w him to change himself and become “respectable”.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: The question is simple, Mr. Barnum -- do you want to give your audience something real? Or just hoodwink them again? Barnum half-smiles. He sits next to her, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: It’s certainly easier to hoodwink them. Not to mention more fun and profitable. She looks at him: what kind of man is he? He nods -- this the price of respectability. Holds up the papers.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll have it changed before you leave.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You mean before we leave? He stops short. They look at each other, both surprised.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: You don’t think I’m going with you?

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Why would you not?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I have a business to run!

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I don’t know anyone in this country!

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: (exasperated) You’1l meet people!

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: I need someone I can trust!

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: You can’t trust me! I’m P.T. Barnum! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 97 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 73.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She laughs, letting her eyes linger. He meets her gaze. There is a connection here. She looks at him, quizzical.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: This tour will make your reputation. You will be the most famous man in America. * But only if you show up. She smiles at him -- don’t you want that? He wavers, at w with himself. Finally, he smiles and nods.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I’1l see you on tour. She smiles, squeezes his hand, then rises and walks out o the restaurant. Barnum looks up to see a WAITER holding t check. He takes the check and sighs, outmaneuvered again. EXT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - DUSK (LATER) 97 Phillip walks out of Barnum’s office, looking at artwork the Jenny Lind tour. He is troubled and anxious. He stops In the middle of the otherwise empty Museum, Anne practic her acrobatic routine, spinning on a rope high up. She is graceful, athletic, beautiful. He gazes at her with longi Muffled SOUNDS of a RUCKUS outside. Phillip turns, frowns EXT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - DAY Phillip steps outside. In front of the box office, a CROW of PROTESTERS are gathered behind a banner, “LEAGUE OF DECENCY”. They hold up signs -- “Close the Circus!” and “Protect Our Children!” A MAN with a bullhorn is shouting

dialogues.speaker: BULLHORN
dialogues.text: Immoral! Indecent! Not fit for polite society! An insult to family values! When they see him, the Protesters erupt with CATCALLS and BOOS. Phillip is taken aback by their JEERS and angry fac Anne joins him at the door, gazing out fearfully. They sh a look. Bravely, Phillip goes and confronts the Bullhorn

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: What is going on here? *

dialogues.speaker: BULLHORN
dialogues.text: We're shutting you down! (into bullhorn) Freaks belong in freak shows! Not here! Send them back where they belong! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 74.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Sir, you have a right to protest, but you cannot block our ticket booth.

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTER
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do about it, boy?! He shoves Phillip. Phillip, not a fighting man, is stunne

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTORS
dialogues.text: We don’t want you here! You don’t belong here! Go back to where you came from! Anne is incensed. She steps out, pointing at Mr. Bullhorn

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: I’m from New York! I’m from right here!

dialogues.speaker: BULLHORN
dialogues.text: Then go back to where you belong!

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTORS
dialogues.text: That's right! Go home! Go back where you belong! Go back to Africa! Anne is stung to the core. Phillip sees this. She turns a retreats into the museum. He runs in after her.

dialogues.speaker: 98-99 OMITTED 98-99
dialogues.text: 100 INT. BARNUM’'S MUSEUM - NIGHT (LATER) 100 The giant space is empty, quiet. Anne sits on the edge of trampoline, shaken and upset. Phillip stands before her, holding her hand. They are in the middle of a heart-to- heart. He is courting her, tenderly. She is sad, skeptica

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: You can’t listen them. Those people are * hateful. Ignorant. He tries to touch her face, but she pulls away, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Don’t... Please... We shouldn’t even be * here like this. *

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Why not? What’s wrong with our being * together? * She smiles sadly -- the question seems naive, quixotic. * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 75.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It is dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Then let us live dangerously. I won’t let those people dictate how I live.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: It’s not just them. Look at the world... Any time I step outside this building...

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Oh, damn the world! If it is made up of fools, that is their problem, not yours! She looks at him, heart melting. He leans in for a kiss. Anne leans to kiss him, then pulls away -- sad and scared He sees her unhappy reluctance -- he must convince her. MUSIC starts. Phillip sings a LOVE SONG with a driving be

dialogues.speaker: YOU KNOW I WANT YOU
dialogues.text: IT’S NOT A SECRET I TRY TO HIDE

dialogues.speaker: SO WHY KEEP SAYING OUR HANDS ARE TIED
dialogues.text: YOU CLAIM IT’S NOT IN THE CARDS

dialogues.speaker: AND OUT OF REACH FROM ME
dialogues.text: BUT YOU’RE HERE IN MY HEART

dialogues.speaker: YOU'RE MY DESTINY
dialogues.text: She climbs the trapeze ladder... dives onto the trampolin then bounces and rotates elegantly in the air... landing directly in front of Phillip. He pulls her into a dance.

dialogues.speaker: YOU'D BE THE ONE I WAS MEANT TO FIND
dialogues.text: IT’S UP TO YOU AND IT’S UP TO ME

dialogues.speaker: NO ONE CAN SAY WHAT WE GET TO BE
dialogues.text: SO WHY DON’T WE REWRITE THE STARS

dialogues.speaker: TONIGHT
dialogues.text: Phillip lets her go. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 76.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: YOU THINK IT’S EASY? YOU THINK I DON’T WANT TO RUN TO YOU?

dialogues.speaker: BUT THERE ARE MOUNTAINS
dialogues.text: AND THERE ARE DOORS THAT WE CAN’T WALK THROUGH Phillip starts up the ladder. He takes a blind leap, land unsteadily on the trampoline. They dance again, closer no

dialogues.speaker: TONIGHT.
dialogues.text: Phillip grabs a low-hanging trapeze and they sit on it, swinging higher and higher. They drop off the trapeze and fall to the trampoline, where they lie together, singing.

dialogues.speaker: IF YOU ARE THE ONE I WAS MEANT TO FIND
dialogues.text: He helps her off the trampoline. They hold each other clo ANNE & PHILLIP (CONT’D) IT’S UP TO YOU * AND IT’S UP TO ME

dialogues.speaker: TONIGHT
dialogues.text: As the SONG ends, they seem about to kiss... She pulls ba Eyes filling with tears, she shakes her head -- it can’t between them. She turns, walks away. He watches, heartbro

dialogues.speaker: 101-3 OMITTED 101-3
dialogues.text: INT. BANK - PRESIDENT’S OFFICE - MANHATTAN - DUSK Barnum sits with the BANK PRESIDENT as a CLERK enters wit sheaf of papers. He sets the papers before Barnum. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 77.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I appreciate your making this loan to me on short notice...

dialogues.speaker: BANK PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Usually we discourage using one’s own home as collateral. But it’s quite a lot you're borrowing for this tour... Barnum hesitates, then signs the document.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Let’s keep this between us, if you don’t mind. I don’t want to worry Mrs. Barnum. The banker nods, though he can’t hide his concern

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum finishes packing his suitcase while Charity sits u bed, watching him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: I don’t understand why you’re leaving.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I just need to be there.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Why? What are we risking this time?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Just the usual. This is true only technically -- he is risking everything

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Then don’t go. Don’t go -- I mean it.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: This will be the biggest musical tour in the history of the country.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: They'll do fine without you.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: We're going to make millions --

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: We don’t need millions. He looks up at her, as a tear run down her face. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104 105 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 78.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When is it going to be enough?! What’s the point of it all -- those two girls, this family -- if you’re never here?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I will be, as soon as the tour is over.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: (darkly) The tour will never be over.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: That’s ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Is it? You don’t need the whole world to love you, Phin. Just a few good people. She stares at him, can feel him wavering.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t go, Phin. Please. He considers, but he’s not ready to hear everything she s

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I have to. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum has turned the kick-off of the tour into a 19th century media circus, with an entire train commandeered a painted to advertise the event. Jenny Lind moves down the platform, surrounded by REPORTERS and FANS. Barnum kisses his girls goodbye. They cry and hug him. He turns to Charity, who is still cross. He kisses her cheek

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I‘ll be back as soon as I can. She is unrelenting. The train whistles. He shrugs sadly, turns and heads to the train. Charity eyes Jenny Lind, blowing kisses to her fans. She watches Barnum disappear onto the train. We STAY ON CHARITY as she sings “Tightrop a song conveying her fears about Barnum leaving with Jenn

dialogues.speaker: TIED WITH A RIBBON
dialogues.text: (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 105 108 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny finishes singing on stage and basks in the loud * applause and thrown flowers. Barnum stands in the wings, watching happily. She turns to smile at Barnum in the win who smiles back, elated at her reception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caroline finishes a small ballet recital with her fellow Ballerinas. They bow. In the audience of parents and * friends, Charity and Helen applaud. Barnum is not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charity walks through the giant house alone. Lonely, she dances by herself, imagining him there. On the floor, his SHADOW joins with hers, dancing, though her arms are empt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum and Jenny are guests of honor at a huge dinner par in Chicago. The Mayor raises a toast to Jenny. Jenny stan and bows graciously. Then she reaches for Barnum. He resists, but she coaxes him to his feet. Everyone applaud (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110 114 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 80.

dialogues.speaker: ALWAYS IN MOTION
dialogues.text: so I RISK IT ALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the Barnum house, Charity and the girls eat dinner. Th are telling stories and laughing. But Charity can’t help notice Barnum’s place at the table is conspicuously vacan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a bookstore in Kansas City, Barnum signs copies of his latest autobiography. Jenny stands by his side, at one po resting her hand on his shoulder in an almost wifely pose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In New York, Charity and the girls walk up the street, in good spirits. They stop in front of a bookstore, surprise

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE -- Barnum’s autobiography is on display under a sig NUMBER ONE BEST SELLER NEXT TO THE BIBLE! It’s bitterswee for Caroline and Helen, a reminder of their absent father

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another theater, another city. Jenny, now in a fur stole, basks in yet another ecstatic response. Barnum watches fr the wings. Then Jenny turns, extends a hand to him. Barnu self-conscious, walks out and joins her, taking her hand. They bow together, as the entire theater applauds. FLASHB pop, lighting them up together in the spotlight of fame.  The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charity, Caroline, and Helen eat breakfast. Charity opens the newspaper and stops. There is a picture of Barnum and Jenny together on stage -- bowing, holding hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train whips through the countryside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum sits next to Jenny, who looks out the window. Then she turns and catches his eye, offering a vulnerable smil He smiles back, reassuring. Jenny closes her eyes, leans head against his shoulder. Barnum lets her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jenny opens a door and lets Barnum into her hotel suite. sweeps in as if walking on air -- high-spirited, elated.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Miss Lind.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Mr. Barnum. Don’t be shy. Come in.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I don’t know if you'd had a chance to see the review in today’s paper. He holds up a folded newspaper. She plucks it from him wi a self-mocking smile, turns and leads him to the living r

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Oh, I never read reviews.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Neither do I. And yet here we are.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Here we are. Did they have anything kind to say? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 82.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He plucks the paper back out of her hand, and reads from as Jenny sits on the couch and pours two glasses of wine.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: “Miss Lind is a virtuoso... The diva of her generation... Her beauty surpassed only by her talent...” He smiles, offers her the paper. She takes it and scans i quickly. Finding something, she smiles, reading aloud.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: “In bringing Miss Lind to our shores, we owe Mr. Barnum our most humble gratitude. The erstwhile showman and one-time Prince of Humbug has transformed himself into a patron of the arts and a connoisseur of the highest order.” She looks up -- happy for him. He’s a bit embarrassed by much this anonymous praise means to him. He shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: You dream and dream... And one day it comes true. It’s touching. He’s almost like a little boy. She stands and hands him a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: It’s what you do. Make dreams come true. She clinks his glass, takes a sip. Suddenly, he sees wher this is going. He wavers -- torn between staying with her and leaving. Then he takes a quick sip, checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Well, two hours to curtain. I’m due at the box office to go through receipts.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Stay for a moment? Please? I’ve been alone all day. She sits on the sofa primly. He relents and sits beside h

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Of course. She looks down, staring at her drink, and laughs to herse

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you laughing at? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 83.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, keeps her eyes on the wine glass.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: When I first met you? I didn’t know what to think. You were so... Unrefined. Unembarrassed. So vital and unafraid.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: And what do you think of me now? She gazes down, unable to meet his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You have surprised the world, Mr. Barnum. And you have surprised me. She takes his hand. He lets her. Quietly, she confesses.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You have taken me in, stolen my heart. You have become everything to me. She looks up at him -- she is his. She leans toward him. There is no denying her beauty, or the emotion in her eye All he has to do is lean forward. And for a moment, he is tempted. But then, just as it seems they will kiss...

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I must go home. He pulls away, gets to his feet. Jenny is stunned, mortif

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Phineas --

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I have stayed too long. I can’t be away from my family anymore. I am wasting my time here. He immediately knows that came out wrong. Jenny turns awa stung. Barnum backtracks quickly and nervously.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What I mean to say is: Mr. Bennett has the itinerary well in hand. I’m not serving any real purpose here. I’m going home tomorrow. Please, tell me you’1ll go on without me. You must finish the tour. She looks at him as if seeing him for the first time. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 84.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Is that all? Do I mean nothing to you? He can’t answer. Jenny turns away, hiding her hurt.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course. Go home to your wife.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Thank you, Jenny. Thank you so much. He starts to leave, then looks at her. Kindly, with regre

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I have misrepresented my intentions toward you in any way, I am very sorry. She nods and turns toward him, putting on a brave face.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You'll come tonight, yes? One last show?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: (smiles) I wouldn’t miss it. Barnum leaves. Jenny watches the door, wiping away a sing tear. Her expression hardens as she looks in to the mirro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yet another audience is on its feet. Jenny takes her bow.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE IN AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Encore!!! Jenny finds Barnum in the wings and summons him out. He resists but she is insistent. Finally he steps out and bo with her. She takes his hand and raises it with hers. A number of camera FLASHES go off from the photographers positioned in front of the stage. Jenny takes note of the photographers and then, suddenly grabs Barnum and kisses full on the lips. In the darkness, the FLASHES continue. Barnum pulls back in shock. She smiles at him sadly.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: What was that?!

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Goodbye.  The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 85.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 117
dialogues.text: INT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - NIGHT The musical finale features most of the Oddities, includi Tom, Lettie, Chang and Eng, and the Lord of Leeds. They a joined by Anne and some ACROBATS. They slowly become awar of a disturbance in the audience.

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Shut it down! Shut it down! In the back of the hall, a group of the PROTESTERS we’ve outside earlier are causing a disturbance. The Oddities begin to falter, unsure of themselves. They look to the wings, where Phillip stands in Barnum’s place He nods, gives them a reassuring signal. The show must go

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTER
dialogues.text: You're all freaks!

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTER
dialogues.text: We don’t want your freak show here!

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Go back where you belong! On stage, the troupe stops. Protesters SHOUT in unison:

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTERS
dialogues.text: Shut it down! Shut it down! The whole show has been disrupted. Phillip leaves the win and waves protectively to the Performers.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Stand back! Stand back! They retreat. He steps forward, addresses the Protesters.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gentleman, please -- either quiet down or I’1ll have to ask you to leave.

dialogues.speaker: PROTESTER
dialogues.text: Yeah, boy? You gonna make us?

dialogues.speaker: W.D., (0.C.)
dialogues.text: No. JI will. Phillip turns to see W.D., pissed, come out and join him. ON ANNE, clocking her brother's defense of Phillip. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 86.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Protester #1, challenged, looks to his confederates. In unison, they charge into the ring, attacking W.D. He flattens the first Protester with a right hook. The other jump him. W.D. takes them all on, but he’s outnumbered. Phillip throws himself into the fight, pulling the Protes off W.D. A melee breaks out, W.D. and Phillip putting up good fight, but clearly outmatched. The AUDIENCE cries ou and retreats from the ring, clutching children protective The show is a shambles. The Protesters have succeeded -- they shut the Circus down. Feeling triumphant, they pump their fists and head to the exit, leaving Phillip and W.D battered but unbroken. They all retreat into --

dialogues.speaker: THE LOBBY AREA
dialogues.text: Where the gang of Protesters suddenly stop, STARTLED to s A platoon of CIRCUS PERFORMERS -- twenty strong at least, just Oddities, but jugglers, acrobats. Standing at the front, glaring, are Lettie, Tom Thumb, O’Clancy, etc.

dialogues.speaker: LETTIE
dialogues.text: You boys don’t like the circus? (deep voice) We don’t like you either. The Performers ATTACK. They outnumber the Protesters and, being circus performers, some of them are freakishly stro In no time the gang is left in a pile on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: TOM THUMB
dialogues.text: (brandishes his fists) You want more of this, fellas? I got plenty to go around! The Protesters scramble and quickly retreat. At the door, beaten Protester sees an oil lantern hanging on the wall. He picks it up, turns, and throws it spitefully onto a be feeding hay. The lantern breaks and the hay catches fire. It spreads to curtains. Suddenly, there are fires spreadi everywhere. The Performers rush to try to put them out. The Protesters share a wicked grin, retreat into the nigh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum steps off the train, carrying suitcases. He looks around. No one greets him. Then the crowd parts, he sees. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 119-20 121 122 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 87.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Charity standing there. Caroline and Helen are with her. They look at him, tentative -- he’s almost a stranger. He put down his suitcase, goes quickly to them and embraces The girls hug him too. He kisses her. She is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: So what made you come rushing home all of a sudden?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I missed you. She smiles slyly -- affectionate, exasperated, suspicious

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: That sounds an awful lot like humbug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum, Charity, Caroline and Helen step outside. Carolin a teen, is reserved. Barnum hugs her anyway, and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: ..-And how is your ballet going?

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: We're practicing every day now. The recital is next month. Suddenly, a FIRE WAGON races by. Another soon follows. Barnum turns, sees a young POLICEMAN running up the stree

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Your place, Mr. Barnum... It’s burning down! Barnum turns to Charity and the Girls. He drops his suitc and they all start to run. EXT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - NIGHT 122 The building is on fire. Flames and smoke pour from the windows. Barnum and Charity and the Girls arrive as just Anne and W.D. emerge from the building, helping usher out Lettie, Tom Thumb, Chang, Eng and the rest of the Odditie

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Where's Phillip? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 88.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Inside! The animals are still in cages! Barnum hears the panicked ROAR of an elephant. He turns a runs into the building. W.D. and Anne follow him in. 123 INT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - NIGHT 123 The place is filled with smoke. Barnum passes WAX FIGURES Napoleon, Marie Antoinette, George Washington, all meltin Barnum finds Phillip at the elephant cage, struggling wit ring of skeleton keys. He looks up, sees Barnum approach.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Thanks for looking after things...!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I can’t find the key! Barnum grabs an ax and smashes the padlock. It busts open Barnum swings the cage door open and... 124 EXT. BARNUM'’S MUSEUM - BACK ALLEY - NIGHT (CONTINUOU Eunice thunders into the alley, to safety. 125 INT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS) 125 Barnum, Phillip, and W.D. hurry to throw open the doors t the horse stables. One by one, the horses bolt to safety. Anne opens the Lion’s cage. It ROARS at her fearsomely. S glares at it, raises a finger. The lion bows its head mee Anne waves her finger -- let’s go. They leave together. 126 EXT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - NIGHT 126 Barnum, Phillip, and W.D. watch as the last horses exit t building. Phillip looks, doesn’t see Anne. Turns to Barnu

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I’m going to find Anne! He runs back into the building before Barnum can stop him The Oddities take refuge at a distance. Caroline glances over, notices Lettie nursing a cut on her wrist.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Lettie, you’re hurt... She takes out a lace handkerchief, wraps it like a bandag (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 89.

dialogues.speaker: LETTIE
dialogues.text: No, don’t ruin your... But it’s too late. Caroline ties off the handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: LETTIE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're a true beauty, kid.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: So are you. They share a smile. A fire truck arrives. FIREMEN jump from the truck. Just then a section of the roof falls, sending embers into the sky. The entire building is now ENGULFED IN FLAMES. Anne comes out with the lion. An animal TRAINER quickly steps up and leads the lion away. Barnum rushes up. *

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: Where's Phillip?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: You didn’t see him? Anne looks back in panic. She starts to run toward the building but Barnum grabs her. He hands her off to W.D.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Keep her here! Anne struggles in W.D.’s arms, then collapses into his ch Charity, Caroline, and Helen watch in horror and disbelie Barnum turns and runs back toward the burning building.

dialogues.speaker: FIREMAN
dialogues.text: Hey! You can’t go in there!

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE
dialogues.text: Daddy!!! She watches, terrified, as Barnum runs into the building. 127 INT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - CONTINUOUS 127 Barnum holds his shirt over his mouth, calling out for Phillip as he moves through the intense heat. A BEAM, engulfed in flames, comes crashing down behind him.  128 129 130 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 90. EXT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM - CONTINUOUS 128 Charity, Caroline, Helen, Anne, W.D., and all of the Oddi watch the building in silence, as the flames devour it. Then, through the smoke, a figure... Barnum emerges carrying Phillip, unconscious, in his arms As soon as they are clear, Barnum collapses to his knees, lays Phillip on the ground. Anne runs to Phillip. Charity Caroline, and Helen descend on Barnum, hugging him.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I’m okay... I’m okay... He stands up, turns. His family gathers around him, sombr The Performers -- Oddities; Acrobats; Trainers -- Barnum’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: whole work family, gather around him as well. Together, t stand and watch as the building, his life’s work, burns u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum turns to Charity. *

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take the girls home. It’s going to be a long night. Charity nods. Barnum turns to see a team of FIREFIGHTERS lift Phillip’s limp body, carry him toward a fire truck..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is laid into a hospital bed by two DOCTORS. He is unconscious, dressed in bandages. The room is large, with rows of beds. As the Doctors turn to leave, Anne steps forward, at his side, looks down, eyes full of tears. A NURSE (white) takes her arm, trying to usher her away.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Miss? You don’t belong in here. Anne turns on her, knocking her hand away. The Nurse reco She sees the hurt and anger in Anne’s eyes. Prim and disapproving, she turns -- Hhhhh! -- and bustles away. Anne turns back, sits down next to Phillip. His hand lies open, as if reaching out. She looks around, self-consciou then reaches forward and takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 130
dialogues.text: 131 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft gl. EXT. BARNUM’S MUSEUM — DAWN 131* Burnt debris blankets the property. Barnum surveys the smoking shell of his building. Barnum falls into a sittin position, spent, gazes at the damage around him, devastat Behind him, a lone figure approaches down the empty stree Roth. Roth arrives to find Barnum, dirty with soot, gazin at the ruins of his museum. Barnum glances up, darkly.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: If you’re here to gloat, I'd reconsider. Roth takes out a handkerchief and wipes down a charred wo chair before sitting down beside Barnum.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: Police caught the folks who started the fire. Just thought you’d like to know. Roth pulls out a flask, offers it. Barnum looks at him, w

dialogues.speaker: ROTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on. You look like you could use it. Barnum relents, takes a swig. Hands it back. Roth smiles, takes another quick nip before he pockets the flask.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll rebuild, I hope. Barnum looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: You hate the circus.

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: I did, at first. It’s everything a critic is supposed to hate -- big, obvious, enjoyable, fun... But when they started protesting? I had to reconsider. (points to ruins) What was going on inside those four walls...? Was democracy at its finest. A celebration of humanity in every form -- big, small, bearded, whatever. And that scares people. That’s why they burned you down. It may not be art, and it’s definitely lowbrow. But it ain’t humbug. Barnum smiles, this is something he never expected to hea (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 131 132 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 92.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Thank God for Jenny’s tour. I can borrow off those profits and rebuild --

dialogues.speaker: ROTH
dialogues.text: The tour? My God, you don’t know...? * Roth reaches into his bag and hands Barnum a morning pape

dialogues.speaker: ROTH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I thought you knew...! On the front page, a PHOTO of the kiss is framed by a hea as lurid as any modern tabloid. The headline reads, “BARN SCANDAL! Jenny Lind Quits U.S. Tour! Sails Today for Swed Barnum’s face falls -- it’s his worst nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CROWD of FANS and PRESS have gathered to see Jenny Lind depart. A line of PORTERS ascend the gangplank onto an OC LINER. Jenny signs a last autograph, smiles for pictures. Then she steps onto the gangplank, follows the Porters up NOISE. She turns. It is Barnum, running up the dock. *

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! Stop right there! He runs up the gangplank to her. He is breathing hard, re faced, furious. She is cool as ice.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You cannot leave. There are forty cities left in your tour. If you break our contract, I will sue you. I will sue you * for everything you are worth! *

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: You've seen the papers this morning?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: That has nothing to do with our contract!

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Indeed, it does, Mr. Barnum. Our contract has a morals clause, which you have broken with your reckless display. My reputation has suffered irreparable harm. You should be glad I am not suing you. On Barnum, as he absorbs the full extent of her calculati The wind goes out of him. He looks up at her, going quiet (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 132 133 134 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 93.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Jenny, please. You can’t leave. I risked everything on this tour.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: As did I, Phineas. It seems we both lost. There is terrible sadness in her eyes. She turns to go.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Jenny. Don’t. I’11 lose the circus. * I‘1l lose my home. You will ruin me. *

dialogues.speaker: JENNY
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s what I want. * He is stunned by her cruelty. She sees this and softens - looking at him with hurt, regret, longing, anger, spite.

dialogues.speaker: JENNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When you are careless with other people, Mr. Barnum, you bring ruin on yourself. Then she turns, walks up the gang plank. He can’t stop he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum bursts in -- desperate, wild-eyed. The Banker look up calmly, unsurprised. Barnum walks urgently toward him.

dialogues.speaker: BANK PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: Mr. Barnum. We have been expecting you.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: My house... Please. Just give me a chance to raise the money elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: BANK PRESIDENT
dialogues.text: You are too late. We foreclosed this morning. Barnum is speechless. The Banker is sad, sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: BANKER
dialogues.text: If you gamble enough times, sir, you are fated one day to lose. EXT. HALLET’S HOUSE - DAY 134 Barnum’s carriage pulls up in front of the house. He gets out, sees Charity carrying a last suitcase into the house He runs after her, following her up onto the front porch. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 134 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 94.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Charity...

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: I don’t want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Come on, Charity. Nothing happened. As he gets close, she throws the afternoon paper at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Oh, something happened. It’s on the front page of every paper in New York.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: She orchestrated the photo so she could quit the tour. I’m not in love with her.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Of course you’re not! Not with her! Not with me! Not with anyone! Just you and your show. Barnum is stung. She turns, eyes brimming with hurt. She gestures to the trunks and suitcases strewn on the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They evicted us this morning. Just showed up and said our home was no longer ours.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I know. I just came from the bank. She starts to cry. Barnum is stricken to see her so hurt.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell me? Why didn’t you talk to me? Before risking everything?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Charity, I will get the house back--...

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: No! Please...! No more promises...! (shakes her head) I married you. Not the house. Not the money. You. You saw the magic in the world. I wanted to live in that world with you... She looks at him. Her eyes search his. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 95.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You used to think you weren’t enough for me. Remember? Now we’re not enough for you. Nothing is. She turns and enters the house, slams the door. Barnum stares, for once he has nothing to say. MUSIC starts unde 135 EXT. STREET - BETHEL, CT. — DUSK 135 Barnum trudges up the road. He stops and looks up at the family mansion, dark and desolate now, with a FOR SALE.

dialogues.speaker: A GIRL WAS WAITING HERE FOR ME
dialogues.text: NOW I’M ALL ALONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum stands in the vast empty house. He gazes around tr to conjure a better reality. But his imagination is gone.

dialogues.speaker: NOW I KNOW
dialogues.text: THAT I’VE BEEN CRAZY

dialogues.speaker: YOU WERE MORE THAN A MILLION DREAMS COMBINED
dialogues.text: Barnum breaks down, starts to sob. MUSIC ends, and we...

dialogues.speaker: FADE OUT
dialogues.text: 137 INT. THE “BARNUM ARMS” - NIGHT 137 Barnum sits alone at the bar, his hat in front of him bes his drink. He stares at mementoes on the wall, reminders everything he’s lost. The door opens and we see Tom Thumb

dialogues.speaker: TOM THUMB
dialogues.text: I figured you'd end up here. He climbs straight onto the bar and walks down it toward Barnum, carrying the “Prince of Humbug” crown in his hand (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 96.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: If you’ve come to get paid, I’m sorry. The money’s gone. All of it.

dialogues.speaker: TOM THUMB
dialogues.text: How ‘bout you buy me a drink, and we'll call it even? He puts the crown on Barnum’s head and sits on Barnum’s h Barnum takes off the crown, puts it on the bar, gazes at TOM THUMB (CONT’D) Lost your kingdom, huh?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Someone once said love your enemies -- because they will tell you the truth.

dialogues.speaker: TOM THUMB
dialogues.text: And what’s the truth? Barnum unfolds a Tribune with the Barnum scandal headline

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: That I’m a fraud. A charlatan. Coarse. Vulgar. Borderline criminal.

dialogues.speaker: TOM THUMB
dialogues.text: Jeez. You say that like it’s a bad thing.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: That’s the good part. Underneath that? I’m nothing. Barely human. A freak. Hearing that word, Tom smiles, amused. He leans in.

dialogues.speaker: TOM THUMB
dialogues.text: Ya know? A very unwise man once said to me, “Be proud of who you are”. Barnum has to smile. Tom looks up, waves, and calls out. TOM THUMB (CONT’D) Hey, I found him! Tolja he’d be here! Barnum looks down the bar and sees Lettie, Chang and Eng, Lord of Leeds, and other performers filing in. They are smiling and relieved, happy to see Barnum. Tom turns back TOM THUMB (CONT’D) That's right, Barnum. You’re a freak. A weirdo. You don’t fit in. Welcome to the human race. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The Oddities crowd around Barnum in a show of support and gratitude. Tom leans in, heated. All joking ceases.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: My mother kept me locked in a back room for years ‘cause she was ashamed of me. It was like that for all of us. But you pushed us in the spotlight. You told the world stories that made them love us. You made us into a family. (beat) Your humbug gave us a home, Barnum. And we want it back. Barnum is deeply moved. MUSIC plays UNDER as he looks at Tom, determination spreading across his face. You'd bette believe he will rebuild his circus. Barnum begins to sing

dialogues.speaker: THE GLITTER FADES AND THE BIG TOP FOLDS
dialogues.text: ‘CAUSE FROM THAT RUBBLE WHAT REMAINS

dialogues.speaker: THERE'S MORE I GAINED
dialogues.text: ‘CAUSE IT LED ME BACK TO YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum rides north out of Manhattan in a carriage.

dialogues.speaker: A CRAZY SPEED OF ALWAYS NEEDING MORE
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 98. 139 EXT. HALLET’S HOUSE - BETHEL, CT - DAY 139 Barnum stands at a distance from the house, watching as Charity and their daughters head into her childhood home.

dialogues.speaker: FROM NOW ON
dialogues.text: The MUSIC quiets but continues UNDER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dim, quiet hospital room. Curtains drawn. Phillip lie in bed, still unconscious. Anne sits next to him, bent ov with exhaustion, head bowed. But still holding his hand. the background, Doctors and Nurses quietly do their round CLOSE ON -- His hand. Gently, it twitches, grasping hers. She raises her head, disbelieving. She clutches his hand, squeezing... He stirs. Then his eyes open. He sees her.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: You're here. A tear falls down her cheek.

dialogues.speaker: ANNE
dialogues.text: “Here” is where I belong. They share a tearful smile. A passing NURSE notices he is awake and waves to others. A handful of Doctors and Nurse gather at the foot of the bed. She leans in and kisses him on the lips, unafraid and unashamed. He wraps his arms around her, kissing her back 140 INT. CHARITY’S HOUSE - BETHEL, CT. - DAY 140 The MUSIC rises briefly, but continues UNDER as... Barnum strides up the front walk, in a mirror of the elopement scene. As he steps onto the porch, Mr. Hallett opens the front door, looks at Barnum with withering disd (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 99.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Mr. Hallet, it seems I am the penniless bum you always said I was. But I am in love with your daughter, and if you don’t mind, I like to see my wife.

dialogues.speaker: MR. HALLETT
dialogues.text: She’s not here. Mr. Hallet moves to close the door, but Barnum stops him.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: MR. HALLETT
dialogues.text: She doesn’t want to see you!

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Where is she?! Hallett moves again to shut the door. Barnum blocks him.

dialogues.speaker: CAROLINE, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: She’s at the beach! They turn. Caroline and Helen are at the top of the stair He smiles. They smile back. He nods -- thank you! -- turn

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence. Charity gazes out at the wintry surf. She looks sad, lost, lonely. The beach is familiar, it’s where they played as kids. Then something catches her eye. She turns In the distance, Barnum walks towards her. His stride is purposeful, but he is a man stripped bare. cockiness or pride. No dazzle or glitz. He is a man at th end of a very long journey, whose prize is finally in sig She’s taken aback -- she’s never seen him like this. As h draws closer, she can see the pain and sorrow in his eyes As they meet, he stops short -- not wanting to say the wr thing. But his eyes betray how desperately he wants her b

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Caroline was kind enough to tell me where you were. She nods but says nothing, watching him warily. Barnum lo away, vulnerable. He falters, searching for the right wor (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 141 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 100.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have brought hardship on myself, and * visited pain upon those I cherish most dearly. You warned me of my folly, and I * would not listen. MUSIC starts under. He keeps his eyes averted, downcast.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you have no warmth in your heart for me, say the word and I will never trouble you again. But if the case is otherwise, then you should know... (looks at her) ..-That I am yours, body and soul. It is your smile, your laughter, that has been my guiding star. Without it, the rest is dust and ashes... I know that now. Her eyes fill with tears. He looks at her with yearning.

dialogues.speaker: A CRAZY SPEED OF ALWAYS NEEDING MORE
dialogues.text: He takes her hand. She draws close to him.

dialogues.speaker: FROM NOW ON, FROM NOW ON
dialogues.text: Charity hugs him, touching her forehead to his. A quiet moment. They are intimate again. He confesses in a whispe

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wanted to be better than who I was. * And I lost my way... * Charity reaches for his face and lifts it to face hers.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: I never wanted anything but you. The man * I fell in love with. * Barnum’s eyes fill with tears. He’s got her back.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: That is the man I will be. From now on. * (beat) * Charity... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 141 142 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 101.

dialogues.speaker: CHARITY
dialogues.text: Stop selling already and kiss me. They kiss. EXT. BANK —- MANHATTAN - DAY 142 Barnum steps out of the bank, loosening his tie.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Did they say no? Barnum looks up to see Phillip, now fully recovered, join him. Barnum offers a small smile, glad to see him.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Emphatically. Repeatedly. (shakes his head) I used to thrive on rejection -- educated men sitting behind desks telling me what I can’t do. But after twenty or thirty times, it starts to wear a fellow down. He sits on the bank steps -- worn out, losing hope.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t think there’s a single sucker in this country that I can fool into giving me money anymore. Phillip sits next to him -- calm and philosophical.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: You know, Barnum? When I first met you, I had an inheritance. I had acclaim. I had invitations to every party in town. And now, thanks to you, that’s gone. Barnum looks at him -- where’s this going?

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All that’s left now is friendship, my love with Anne, and work I adore. So thanks a lot, Barnum. (turning serious) You brought joy into my life, where there was none before. It’s the one thing you’re good at.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Yes, unfortunately, banks don’t accept joy as collateral. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 102.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Still, there’s a few suckers out there. Barnum looks at him -- what does that mean? Phillip grins

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I own ten percent of the show, remember? I've been taking my cut every week. If it helps, I’ve got about twelve thousand stashed away. Barnum looks at Phillip, surprised. He grins.
