dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: But I can’t let you gamble it all on me.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Come on. Has there ever been a man in this country who’s created so much out of sheer imagination? It’s not a gamble. Barnum smiles. Phillip puts out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Partners? Beat. Barnum takes his hand, and they shake. They stand u

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: You know it’s not enough to buy a new building...

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Oh, we don’t need a building! I can get land down by the docks for nothing! What we really need is a tent! A big one! Colorful and festive! That will make you stop and want to see what’s inside...! Phillip grins. As they walk off, Barnum puts his arm arou him, spinning his latest vision.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .+.-The great thing about a tent is when you're done with it, you take it down, pack it up, take it on the road! Don’t you see? With a tent we can go anywhere! Why, the world itself becomes our home!

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: It’s good to have you back, PT. PRELAP: Music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e * HF  The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SLEDGEHAMMER hits a metal stake, driving it deep into t ground. We WIDEN to find DOZENS OF WORKERS across the fie Barnum pitches in, sleeves rolled, honest sweat on his br Phillip picks up a sledgehammer and joins the others.

dialogues.speaker: AND WE WILL COME BACK HOME AGAIN
dialogues.text: MUSIC ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip and Anne are married on a Sunday morning. Except W.D., both families have boycotted the ceremony. * But the bride and groom are surrounded by their adopted family of circus performers, with Caroline and Helen as flower girls, and Barnum and Charity bearing witness.  The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The glorious tent, the first, is pitched and ready to go. The attractions are all here, as well as dozens of animal and TRAINERS, and other CREW. The anticipation is palpabl The sun sets and dozens of CARBON ARC LAMPS blast on, bat the circus in a warm glow. We CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum stands watching as, in the distance, CROWDS stream into the tent. Phillip walks up, joins him. Barnum turns.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: I have a job for you.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: I thought I had a job.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: The circus has three rings now. There’s a lot happening. We need a master of ceremonies to guide the audience. He takes off his Top Hat, hands it over. A DRUM begins UN

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Congratulations. You’re the Ringmaster.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: But I’m not a performer.

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Everyone’s got an act, Mr. Carlyle. Phillip smiles, recalling the first words Anne said to hi

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'd do it myself, but I plan to be busy.

dialogues.speaker: PHILLIP
dialogues.text: Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: BARNUM
dialogues.text: Watching my girls grow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We return to Barnum’s reverie from the opening of the mov Barnum gazes at the crowd, taking in the joy and exciteme all around him. SOUND FADES. In a wistful moment, he sing to himself about the long road it took to get here. * (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 147 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 105.

dialogues.speaker: THAT THE SUN GIVES US LIGHT
dialogues.text: Barnum watches proudly as Phillip puts on his top hat, th steps into the rings -- the new Ringmaster. SOUND returns Barnum checks his pocket watch, then turns. Eunice, the elephant, is held by a Trainer at the edge of the tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum rides Eunice down Fifth Avenue, drawing stares and Gawkers. KIDS run along side, thrilled to see an elephant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charity, Caroline, and Helen wait on the steps of the Met Caroline wears a tutu under her coat. Around them, Parent and young Ballerinas climb the stairs and stream into the museum entrance. A small banner reads, “Metropolitan Annu Ballet Recital”. Charity checks a distant tower clock. * Helen sees something, points. They all react with disbeli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE -- Barnum rides Eunice up towards the Met steps.

dialogues.speaker: TO WANDER FROM THE PATH
dialogues.text: IS HOW YOU KNOW YOU’RE HOME * Helen giggles. Charity smiles, shakes her head. Caroline hides her face in her hands, but she is laughing -- she h accepted Barnum for who he is, grand gestures and all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip stands in the center ring and gazes in wonder as circus goes full throttle all around him. He turns to Ann and sings. She smiles affectionately at her new husband.

dialogues.speaker: YOU MAKE ME REAL
dialogues.text: MAKE ME FEEL I’M ALIVE *

dialogues.speaker: EVERY REASON TO SURVIVE
dialogues.text: He puts an arm around her. She wraps her arms around him.  148 The Greatest Showman On Earth 4/20/15 Draft 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnum slides down Eunice’s trunk, hands a leash to a startled young VALET. He strides up to his family.

dialogues.speaker: AREN'T HALF AS FUN
dialogues.text: They hug him, then turn and sing together.

dialogues.speaker: IF IT WEREN'T FOR YOU
dialogues.text: Barnum, his arms around his wife and daughters, turn and up the Museum steps together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Big Top, lit within, stands on the Brooklyn shore. MU plays UNDER as we hear the CROWD APPLAUD inside the tent. We CRANE UP, rising high, as FIREWORKS explode across sky CIRCLE AROUND to SEE the across the river is the contempo skyline of Manhattan. Barnum’s legacy still stands -- mor than a century later -- as The Greatest Show On Earth.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: “The noblest art is that of making others happy” -- P. T. Barnum
